meanings.definition: Unable to be decided or resolved.
meanings.sent1: The situation was undecidability, leaving everyone unsure of what to do.
meanings.sent2: Her undecidability on the matter caused confusion among the group.
meanings.sent3: The undecidability of which movie to watch led to a game of rock-paper-scissors.
meanings.sent4: The undecidability of the situation hung over them like a dark cloud.
meanings.sent5: The undecidability of the puzzle made it frustrating yet intriguing to solve.

meanings.definition: The quality or state of being undecidable.
meanings.sent1: The undecidability of the issue made it hard to reach a conclusion.
meanings.sent2: She pondered the undecidability of the question late into the night.
meanings.sent3: The undecidability of the flavors in the ice cream left him puzzled.
meanings.sent4: The undecidability of the outcome kept them on edge.
meanings.sent5: The undecidability of the path ahead filled her with both excitement and anxiety.
